tags.inscription: SIMON FRASER ¶ 1776 - 1862 ¶ Erected by the Native Sons of B.C. and unveiled by Sir Richard McBride 1908 to commemorate the discovery voyage down the river by Simon Fraser 1808.
tags.name: Simon Fraser

tags.description: Passenger celebrates the history of rail service in White Rock and the significance of visitors who awaited their journey at the White Rock Train Station.
tags.name: Passenger

tags.description: Infinity Cycle is a figurative-abstract public sculpture commissioned by the City of White Rock in 2017. This stainless steel sculpture is created in commemoration of the 37th anniversary of the Tour de White Rock.
tags.name: Infinity Cycle

tags.description: The amphitheater-like sculpture blurs the line between art, sculpture and landscape. The fifty LED lights embedded into the curved pipes create an evening glow. Installed in 2013.
tags.name: Rostrum

tags.description: Installed in 2007 as a representation of the marine environment in White Rock, this piece embodies the rolling waves of the ocean and crashing surf.
tags.name: Holes in the Sky

tags.description: This mural of a grey whale family with Pacific bottlenose dolphins is part of the 79 city Wyland Walls campaign to increase appreciation for aquatic habitats. Installed in 1984.
tags.name: The Gray Whale Family

tags.description: This monolithic granite bear stands at the end of the East Beach Promenade and was placed as a memorial in 1999. The name Grizlee refers to Frank’s son, Lee.
tags.name: Grizlee

tags.description: The mosaic steps offer a spot to relax while wandering East Beach. Each step has been decorated using pieces of colourful tile and placed in the pattern of sunshine. Installed in 2004.
tags.name: Walking on Sunshine

tags.description:
This wall painting shows two steam-powered trains inside an old fashion train stations and silhouettes of people waiting on a platform.

The artwork is located on the back of a building and also visible from the Renfrew SkyTrain station.
Wolfes in a snowy forest at night.
A woman with a white dress is sitting on a roof. In the background one can see the moon, mountains and skyscrapers.

tags.description: A mural of an orange bird flying upwards towards the start and the hands of a human spread above the bird's wings.

tags.description: Gnomon, featured in Fleetwood Park’s perennial garden, is inspired by the notion of a sundial marking time. A gnomon is the central part of a sundial that casts a shadow that marks the passage of time. This artwork tells the story of the passage of time i
tags.name: Gnomon
